posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.48.0-beta.1. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • We added a convenient shortcut to quickly lower your hand after you start speaking during a Signal group call. It‚Äôs hands down our favorite feature in this release.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.47.0-beta.1‚Ä¶v7.48.0-beta.1 ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Desktop ¬∑ GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.47 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.48.0-beta.1

39 new commits since 7.47.0-beta.2:

Show commits

  • v7.48.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Use node_linker=hoisted in npmrc to fix electron-builder with pnpm [2]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.2 [3]

  • Handle server alerts received on libsignal auth socket [4]

  • Enable "Lower hand" suggestions [5]

  • Ensure that stories download on view (#9945) [6]

  • Calling: New option to expand your local preview [7]

  • Fix getNextAttachmentDownloadJobs query [8]

  • Enable libsignal CDSI connect logic by default [9]

  • Fix file save dialog default path for Linux KDE [10]

  • Release notes for 7.47 [11]

  • Update strings [12]

  • Update DNS fallback [13]

  • ICU book workflow [14]

  • Support idle primary device warning alert from server [15]

  • Remove unused .node file on win/linux [16]

  • Ignore electron-winstaller dependency [17]

  • Upgrade electron-builder to 26.0.10 to fix packaging for pnpm [18]

  • Ensure that download is no longer pending on abort [19]

  • Prefer article modified times in link preview descriptions [20]

  • Relax media checks in calling lobbies [21]

  • Fix sequencing of call state updates [22]

  • Ensure that send proceeds even if quote thumbnail attachment not found [23]

  • Upgrade electron to 35.0.2 [24]

  • Compose: Show 'search for username' by itself more often [25]

  • Fix github actions to specific commit hashes [26]

  • Skip building x64/arm64 dmg for macOS [27]

  • Fix installer size dd script [28]

  • MessageReceipts: Removed dropped receipts from cache and database [29]

  • Composer: Properly update quill state on clipboard cut [30]

  • Fix alignment of control rows in settings window [31]

  • Fix alignment of control rows in settings window [32]

  • didSendToEveryone: Handle situations where you didn't send to yourself [33]

  • Composer: Better handle option-delete keypresses on macOS [34]

  • Composer/cut: Rely on Quill to update both DOM and its internal state [35]

  • Fix error in 'before each' hook [36]

  • Release notes for 7.48 [37]

  • Update strings [38]

  • 7.48.0-beta.1 [39]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.47.0-beta.2‚Ä¶v7.48.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn‚Äôt).

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from ‚ÄúUpdated language translations‚Äù and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.47.0-beta.2 so far here.

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
After many tries message transfer from Android finally failed, so the new device got linked but without message history:

Screenshot 2025-03-20 at 17.09.111602√ó1162 39.4 KB

The only issue is not having access to the app while the transfer happens, even ejecting the transfer would be a good option, in cases the transfer gets too long.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.48.0-beta.1/f6dc0a27ca4b3483bd71d98a493dc6b1f90fbe4a1542a0056a35ccc66d6a81ad.gz

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.38.3/b5756dd31826fafe7b9307b6cafacf215519cd571cf865100a29d6de6793fe77

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
Pinned conversations are not synced in the correct order.

Log

This text will be hidden

I tested link n sync for the first time in about a month though, and it worked flawlessly. Wonderful job!

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked: @Avitus Glad to hear that Link&Sync worked for you, but I guess there was one small flaw? How exactly did the pinned chats differ between desktop and your other devices?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
On my phone the order is:

A
B
C
D

On Desktop the order is:

D
A
C
B

I‚Äôve just unpinned and re-pinned on my phone. It‚Äôs all synced in the correct order on Desktop when I pin A, B, and C, but as soon as I pin D, it jumbles out of order.

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
@Avitus What devices do you have linked to your account? Your primary phone, this new Link&Sync‚Äôd desktop, and what else?

This new report, that it persists when making changes suggests that it‚Äôs bad interactions between all of your devices. We‚Äôd really like a debug log from each of them to help track it down.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
Just the primary phone, which is Android.

Android Log

This text will be hidden

Ubuntu Linux Log

This text will be hidden

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.49 release.
